form.label: Splunk Audit - Overview of saved searches per user

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=local search="is_scheduled=1" search="disabled=0" | rename eai:acl.app as app, title as savedsearch_name, eai:acl.owner as user, eai:acl.sharing as sharing, alert.expires as alert_expires | eval scheduled_type=if(alert_type=="always", "report", "alert") | eval report_accelaration=if(auto_summarize=="1", "yes", "no") | table savedsearch_name app user scheduled_type cron* dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time report_accelaration alert_expires actions search
index=_internal savedsearch_name="$savedsearch_name$" sourcetype=scheduler [| inputlookup splunkref | search $function$ | eval host=fqdn | table host] user=$user$ $app$|fields *
search user=$user$|dedup app | table app | sort app
| rest /services/authentication/users splunk_server=local | eval user=title | eval realname=realname+" ("+user+")" | table user realname
| inputlookup scheduled_searches | search author=$user$ AND current="1"
search user=$user$ $app$ |dedup savedsearch_name |table savedsearch_name |sort savedsearch_name
| inputlookup splunkref | dedup function | search function=search* | table function | sort function

html.p: This dashboard gives you as an admin insights of saved searches, per user and per app. You can select to only look at intesive saved searches or any. An intensive search is scheduled every minute or up to every 5th minute.

panel.title: Executions per saved search typ

search.query: lookup scheduled_searches savedsearch_name OUTPUT known as intensive | fillnull intensive value="0" | eval type=case( intensive==1, "Intensive", intensive==0, "Normal") | stats dc(sid) as count by type | sort - count

panel.title: Accumulated run time per saved search type

search.query: lookup scheduled_searches savedsearch_name OUTPUT known as intensive | fillnull intensive value="0" | eval type=case( intensive==1, "Intensive", intensive==0, "Normal") | stats sum(run_time) as sum_run_time by type | sort - sum_run_time

panel.title: Number of skipped per type of saved search

search.query: lookup scheduled_searches savedsearch_name OUTPUT known as intensive | fillnull intensive value="0" | eval type=case( intensive==1, "Intensive", intensive==0, "Normal") | search status=skipped | stats count by type | sort - count

panel.title: Number of active saved searches

search.query: dedup savedsearch_name app |stats count

panel.title: Number of intensive searches

search.query: | inputlookup scheduled_searches where current="1" | rename author as user | search user=$user$ $app$ | dedup savedsearch_name app | stats count

panel.title: Top users

search.query: search user=$user$ $app$ savedsearch_name="$savedsearch_name$" $alert_expires$ $scheduled_type$ $cron_schedule$ $dispatch.earliest_time$ $dispatch.latest_time$ $report_accelaration$|top user

panel.title: Top intensive users

search.query: | inputlookup scheduled_searches where current="1" | rename author as user | search user=$user$ $app$ | top user

panel.title: Top app

search.query: search user=$user$ $app$ savedsearch_name="$savedsearch_name$" $alert_expires$ $scheduled_type$ $cron_schedule$ $dispatch.earliest_time$ $dispatch.latest_time$ $report_accelaration$|top app

panel.title: Top app with intensive searches

search.query: | inputlookup scheduled_searches where current="1" | rename author as user | search user=$user$ $app$ | top app

panel.title: Number of execution per saved search

search.query: stats dc(sid) as count by savedsearch_name | sort - count

panel.title: Number of execution per intensive saved search

search.query: lookup scheduled_searches savedsearch_name OUTPUT known as intensive | search intensive=1 | stats dc(sid) as count by savedsearch_name | sort - count

panel.title: Accumulated run time per saved search

search.query: stats sum(run_time) as sum_run_time by savedsearch_name | sort - sum_run_time

panel.title: Accumulated run time per intensive saved search

search.query: lookup scheduled_searches savedsearch_name OUTPUT known as intensive | search intensive=1 | stats sum(run_time) as sum_run_time by savedsearch_name | sort - sum_run_time

panel.title: Number of skipped per saved search

search.query: search status=skipped | stats count by savedsearch_name | sort - count

panel.title: Number of skipped per intensive saved search

search.query: lookup scheduled_searches savedsearch_name OUTPUT known as intensive | search intensive=1 | search status=skipped | stats count by savedsearch_name | sort - count

panel.title: Summary on how many apps do the user have scheduled searches?

search.query: stats dc(app) as app, dc(user) as users dc(savedsearch_name) as savedsearches, values(reason) as reason, values(status) as status, avg(result_count) as result_count avg(run_time) as avg_run_time, perc95(run_time) as perc95_run_time max(run_time) as max_run_time, dc(sid) as "How many executions" | eval avg_run_time=round(avg_run_time,2), max_run_time=round(max_run_time,2), perc95_run_time=round(perc95_run_time,2), result_count=round(result_count,2)

panel.title: Saved searches that exist in more than one app

search.query: search user=$user$ $app$ savedsearch_name="$savedsearch_name$" $alert_expires$ $scheduled_type$ $cron_schedule$ $dispatch.earliest_time$ $dispatch.latest_time$ $report_accelaration$|stats dc(app) as DistinctCountApp by savedsearch_name | search DistinctCountApp>1 | table savedsearch_name DistinctCountApp

panel.title: Timeline of running saved searches for user $user$ and the saved search called $savedsearch_name$ in the $app$

search.query: dedup scheduled_time | eval run_time=run_time*3600 | eval run_time=round(run_time,0) | stats latest(status) as status max(run_time) as run_time first(_time) as _time by savedsearch_name scheduled_time | table _time savedsearch_name status run_time

panel.title: Timechart of runtime per saved search in seconds

chart.title: Click on line to select saved search details

search.query: timechart limit=0 max(run_time) by savedsearch_name

panel.title: Timechart of how many times a search have been skipped

chart.title: Click to select saved search details

search.query: search status=skipped | timechart limit=0 count by savedsearch_name

panel.title: Timechart of number of events returned per saved search

chart.title: Click on line to select saved search details

search.query: timechart limit=0 max(result_count) by savedsearch_name

panel.title: Full details of the saved searches

search.query: dedup scheduled_type | table scheduled_type | sort scheduled_type
dedup cron_schedule | table cron_schedule | sort cron_schedule
dedup dispatch.earliest_time | table dispatch.earliest_time | sort dispatch.earliest_time
dedup dispatch.latest_time | table dispatch.latest_time | sort dispatch.latest_time
dedup report_accelaration | table report_accelaration | sort report_accelaration
dedup alert_expires | table alert_expires | sort alert_expires

table.title: Click on row to select saved search details

search.query: search user=$user$ $app$ savedsearch_name="$savedsearch_name$" $alert_expires$ $scheduled_type$ $cron_schedule$ $dispatch.earliest_time$ $dispatch.latest_time$ $report_accelaration$ ``` Following is aditional for ITSI. It translates any base search id's found in savedsearch_name with ITSI KPI Base search name. Thanks to Sara Lord for supplying newly baked bread that helped to solve it!``` | rex field=savedsearch_name "Indicator - Shared - (?<key>.+?)\s-" | join type=left [| inputlookup kpi_base_search_title_lookup | eval key=_key] | rename title as kpi_base_search_title |fields - key | table savedsearch_name kpi_base_search_title app user scheduled_type cron_schedule dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time report_accelaration alert_expires $actions$ $search$

panel.title: Saved searches that has zero results returned

search.query: stats min(result_count) as result_count by savedsearch_name | search result_count<1 | dedup savedsearch_name | table savedsearch_name | sort savedsearch_name
